Buttons

Default Button

Default Button
Details:

This is the default button, no frills or modifying classes. Rounded buttons such as this one (along with other size/color combinations) should be used on pages where there are multiple actions a user can take from one page, such as a configuration application.

CSS
/*
 * Button styles
 */
a.button {
  display: inline-block;
  font-size: 1em;
  padding: 0.8em 0.8em;
  vertical-align: middle;
  margin: 0 0 1em;
  text-align: center;
  border-radius: 4px;
  font-family: scala-sans-reg;
  color: $white;
  background-color: $primary-blue;
  border: 1px solid $primary-blue;
  cursor: pointer;

  &:hover {
    background-color: $secondary-blue;
    color: $white;
    text-decoration: none;
  }
HTML
<a class="button">Default Button</a>

Sizes

Large Button Medium Button Small Button Tiny Button
Details:

If no size is specificed, the button height defaults to 40px and no minimum width.

CSS
  /* Button Sizes */

  &.large {
    font-size: 20px;
    padding: 20px 20px;
    min-width: 250px;
  }

  &.medium {
    font-size: 16px;
    padding: 13px 13px;
    min-width: 250px;
  }

  &.small {
    font-size: 14px;
    padding: 9px 9px;
    min-width: 175px;
  }

  &.tiny {
    font-size: 13px;
    padding: 5px 5px;
  }
HTML
<a class="button large">Large Button</a>
<a class="button medium">Medium Button</a>
<a class="button small">Small Button</a>
<a class="button tiny">Tiny Button</a>

Colors

Primary Button Secondary Button Destructive Button Disabled Button
Details:

Primary is the default button color if no color is specified.

CSS
/* Button Colors */

&.primary {
  color: $white;
  background-color: $primary-blue;
  border: 1px solid $primary-blue;

  &:hover {
    background-color: $secondary-blue;
    color: $white;
  }
}

&.secondary {
  color: $primary-blue;
  background-color: $white;
  border: 1px solid $primary-blue;

  &:hover {
    background-color: rgba(0, 118, 192, 0.05); /*change to hex*/
    color: $primary-blue;
  }
}
&.destructive {
  color: $red;
  background-color: $white;
  border: 1px solid $red;

  &:hover {
    background-color: #f7eff2;
    color: $red;
  }
}

&.disabled {
  color: $white;
  background-color: $gray;
  border: 1px solid $gray;

  &:hover{
    cursor: default;
  }
}
HTML
<a class="button primary">Primary Button</a>
<a class="button secondary">Secondary Button</a>
<a class="button destructive">Destructive Button</a>
<a class="button disabled">Disabled Button</a>

Expanded

Expanded Large Button Expanded Tiny Button

Table with Expanded Buttons

These buttons take up 100% of their table cell width:

Expanded Small Button Expanded Small Button Expanded Small Button
Details:

Expanded buttons to only be used for mobile and narrow viewports. The take up 100% of the width of their parent element.

CSS
&.expand {
  display: block;
  width: 100%;
  padding-right: 0em;
  padding-left: 0em;
}
HTML
<a class="button large expand">Expanded Large Button</a>
<a class="button tiny expand">Expanded Tiny Button</a>
<br /><br />
<h4>Table with Expanded Buttons</h4>
<p>These buttons take up 100% of their table cell width:</p>
<table style="width: 100%">
	<tr>
		<td>
			<a class="button small expand">Expanded Small Button</a>
		</td>
		<td>
			<a class="button small expand">Expanded Small Button</a>
		</td>
		<td>
			<a class="button small expand">Expanded Small Button</a>
		</td>
	</tr>
</table>

Example Combinations

Default Button Secondary Large Button Destructive Tiny Button Disabled Expanded Small Button
Details:

Button sizes and colors can be mixed and matched.

HTML
<a class="button">Default Button</a>
<a class="button large secondary">Secondary Large Button</a>
<a class="button tiny destructive">Destructive Tiny Button</a>
<a class="button small disabled expand">Disabled Expanded Small Button</a>

Radius Options

Pill

Default Button Secondary Large Button Destructive Tiny Button
Details:

Buttons with a pill shape are to be used when there is one concrete action that a user needs to take on a page to move on in the workflow. (For example, "Save and Continue" in an application in App Portal.)

CSS
 /*Border Radius */

&.pill {
  border-radius: 50px;
}
HTML
<h4>Pill</h4>
<a class="button pill">Default Button</a>
<a class="button large secondary pill">Secondary Large Button</a>
<a class="button tiny destructive pill">Destructive Tiny Button</a>

Minimal Buttons

Minimal Button
Details:

This is the default minimal button. Only text shows up, however a light grey background does show up on hover. This button style is to be used when there are too many potential actions on a page to give them all a normal button treatment, as well as the bottom buttons inside modals.

CSS
/*
 * Minimal Button Styles
 */
 .button-minimal{
   font-size: 18px;
   font-family: scala-sans-reg;
   font-weight: bold;
   color: $primary-blue;
   padding: 10px;
   border-radius: 4px;

   &:hover{
     background-color: #f7f7fb;
     cursor: pointer;
     text-decoration: none;
   }
 }
HTML
<a class="button-minimal">Minimal Button</a>

Minimal Button Sizes

Large Minimal Button Medium Minimal Button Small Minimal Button Tiny Minimal Button
Details:

Minimal buttons can also have modifying classes to control their size.

CSS
/*
 * Minimal Button Sizes
 */
 &.large {
   font-size: 20px;
   padding: 20px;
 }

 &.medium {
   font-size: 16px;
   padding: 13px;
 }

 &.small {
   font-size: 14px;
   padding: 9px;
 }

 &.tiny {
   font-size: 13px;
   padding: 5px;
 }
HTML
<a class="button-minimal large">Large Minimal Button</a>
<a class="button-minimal medium">Medium Minimal Button</a>
<a class="button-minimal small">Small Minimal Button</a>
<a class="button-minimal tiny">Tiny Minimal Button</a>

Minimal Button Colors

Primary Minimal Button Destructive Minimal Button
Details:

Minimal buttons can be either the primary color (most common use) or the destructive color (for destructive actions such as deleting something.)

CSS
/*
 * Minimal Button Colors
 */
 &.primary {
   color: $primary-blue;

   &:hover {
     background-color: #f7f7fb;
     cursor: pointer;
     text-decoration: none;
   }
 }

 &.destructive {
   color: $red;

   &:hover {
     background-color: #f7f7fb;
     cursor: pointer;
     text-decoration: none;
   }
 }
HTML
<a class="button-minimal primary">Primary Minimal Button</a>
<a class="button-minimal destructive">Destructive Minimal Button</a>

Minimal Buttons With Icons

Edit Delete
Details:

Minimal buttons may also have icons when appropriate. Such as an "edit" or "delete" type action in a configuration app. The icons should be FontAwesome Regular characters.

HTML
<a class="button-minimal primary"><i class="far fa-pencil"></i> Edit</a>
<a class="button-minimal destructive"><i class="far fa-trash"></i> Delete</a>
